result.execSummary:
The defendant Dejuan T Carson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cost to be paid as a condition of probation

Defendant to continue to attend classes and any additional classes to be determined by agent.  No contact with R.E.W. or John and Sharilynn W. until agreed upon by agent and caseworker.  Be complaint with all orders of Courts with competent jurisdiction.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dejuan T Carson

Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated - Regular.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dejuan T Carson in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey S Gaines.   Brian J Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advised court that the victim was planning on coming to the sentencing and they were unable to get a hold of the victim to advise of time change. Court in recess to await for the victim. Court reconvened at 3:00 p.m. Court reviewed letters submited by Defense. Cassandra Crosby spoke on defendant's behalf. 
Court sentenced to the following:
- 1 year Probation, Sentence withheld
- Court costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation;
- Conditions of Probation: Defendant to continue to attend classes and any additional classes to be determined by agent. No contact with R.E.W. or John and Sharilynn W. until agreed upon by agent and caseworker. Be compliant with all orders of Courts with competent jurisdiction.
Sentencing hearing on June 18, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
